identificationModule.briefTitle: Evaluation of Clinical Decision Support System for Large Vessel Occlusion Using Brain CT Images
identificationModule.officialTitle: An Open Label, Single-center, Retrospective, Pivotal Study to Evaluate the Efficacy of Clinical Decision Support System for Large Vessel Occlusion Using Brain CT Images

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
cELVO is a software that has been pre-learned based on a large vessel occlusion diagnosis model using brain CT images, and clinical decision support system for diagnosing large vessel occlusion by automatically analyzing brain CT images by assisting the medical team.

The specific aims of this study are to evaluate efficacy of cELVO compared to the sensitivity and specificity levels of medical team to diagnosis with and without cELVO used.

armGroups.label: Positive group
armGroups.description: A patient diagnosed with large vessel occlusion after a non-contrast CT, CT perfusion and CT angiography

armGroups.label: Negative group
armGroups.description: A normal person or a patient not diagnosed with intracranial haemorrhage after a non-contrast CT, CT perfusion and CT angiography

interventions.name: 1st Reading
interventions.description: The medical team visually checks the non-contrast CT without cELVO and diagnose the large vessel occlusion.

interventions.name: 2nd Reading
interventions.description: The medical team visually checks the non-contrast CT with assistance from the cELVO and diagnose the large vessel occlusion.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Sensitivity and specificity of medical team compared with/without cELVO
primaryOutcomes.description: Sensitivity and specificity of determining large vessel occlusion of medical team when using cELVO compared to not using cELVO
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 2 weeks after completion of reading

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Accuracy of medical team compared with/without cELVO
secondaryOutcomes.description: Accuracy of determining large vessel occlusion of medical team when using cELVO compared to not using cELVO
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 2 weeks after completion of reading

secondaryOutcomes.measure: ROC Curve for medical team compared with/without cELVO
secondaryOutcomes.description: ROC Curve of determining large vessel occlusion of medical team when using cELVO compared to not using cELVO
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 2 weeks after completion of reading

secondaryOutcomes.measure: AUC values for medical team compared with/without cELVO
secondaryOutcomes.description: AUC values of determining large vessel occlusion of medical team when using cELVO compared to not using cELVO
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 2 weeks after completion of reading

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Sensitivity and specificity of each reader compared with/without cELVO
secondaryOutcomes.description: Sensitivity and specificity of determining large vessel occlusion of each reader when using cELVO compared to not using cELVO
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 2 weeks after completion of reading

secondaryOutcomes.description: Sensitivity and specificity of cELVO in diagnosis of large vessel occlusion based on golden standards
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 2 weeks after completion of reading

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Adults over 19 years old
* Brain non-contrast CT, CT perfusion and CT angiography acquired
* Positive group: A patient diagnosed with large vessel occlusion after a non-contrast CT, CT perfusion and CT angiography
* Negative group: A normal person or a patient not diagnosed with large vessel occlusion after a non-contrast CT, CT perfusion and CT angiography

Exclusion Criteria:

* Poor or incomplete brain non-contrast CT, CT perfusion and CT angiography quality
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: (1) Adults over 19 years old (2) Brain non-contrast CT, CT perfusion and CT angiography acquired (3) who confirmed with large vessel occlusion(positive group) or not large vessel occlusion or normal(negative group)
